==Classification of Necrophilia==
  +
Aggrawal<ref name="aggrawal_classification">{{cite journal |author=Aggrawal, A. |title=A new classification of necrophilia |journal=J Forensic Leg Med |volume=16 |issue=6 |pages=316-20 |year=2009 |month=August |pmid=19573840 |doi=10.1016/j.jflm.2008.12.023 |url=http://www.sciencedirect.com/science?_ob=ArticleURL&_udi=B8CY1-4VGDNXT-2&_user=5081486&_coverDate=08%2F31%2F2009&_rdoc=5&_fmt=high&_orig=browse&_srch=doc-info(%23toc%2340101%232009%23999839993%231262082%23FLA%23display%23Volume)&_cdi=40101&_sort=d&_docanchor=&_ct=22&_acct=C000047720&_version=1&_urlVersion=0&_userid=5081486&md5=d9a87333539d30346df1d65ec7a68121}}</ref> has suggested a ten tier classification of necrophilia. The classes suggested by him are Class I necrophiliacs: role players; Class II necrophiliacs: romantic necrophiles; Class III necrophiliacs: People having a necrophilic fantasy â necrophilic fantasizers; Class IV necrophiliacs: tactile necrophiles; Class V necrophiliacs: people having a fetishistic necrophilia â fetishistic necrophiles; Class VI necrophiliacs: people having a necromutilomania â necromutilomaniacs; Class VII necrophiliacs: opportunistic necrophiles; Class VIII necrophiliacs: regular necrophiles; Class IX necrophiliacs: homicidal necrophiles and Class X necrophiliacs: exclusive necrophiles.
